CONVERSATION GROUP:
IF NOT: TOLLIN_AFTER_CAVE
BK I'm glad you dealt with those bandits. Mercenaries. Whatever. I heard about your halfling friend. I suppose we've all lost someone today.
We can't dwell on our losses today.

BK Reframing Tollin. He's the boss and you guys are guards.
BK Ah, good morning. I heard you and your friends had a rough night last night. I can spare a few sips of a curative tincture if it'll help.
Set if the player hasn't spoken to Tollin yet. (TOLLIN_BEFORE_AMBUSH)
BK Anytime. I wouldn't want anyone to travel this route with the weight of a fitful sleep on their shoulders.

BK The High Road's a dangerous one. It may be the most traveled route to Luskan, but in my twelve years of working this route, I can count the number of times we got through without incident on one hand. And I lost one of my fingers in a fishing accident.
We'll get you to Luskan. Guaranteed.
Don't let me keep you. I'm looking forward to getting under way, and I know I'm not the only one.
BK I sense there's a story behind this "fishing accident" thing.
BK Oh boy, is there ever. Maybe one day I'll have a chance to share it.
Ha! Yes, I bet you could. From the sound of it, all three of you were saving the world in your sleep!
I meant nothing by it. I just want to make sure everyone is at their best. That's all.

I think things are shaping up. We should be ready to go in the next hour or so.
IF: TOLLIN_BEFORE_AMBUSH

BJ 7/22/2015 - removed condition. Ok for this dialog to repeat (it needs to, if other conditions are not met.) We CANNOT HAVE the 2 "have you found Martumal" starting conditions repeat. [Quest: CH1_Cave_GoblinInformant [CH1_C_GI_TollinAfterAmbush] needs to be is false]

BK I just.... In my years leading a caravan through here, I've never met bandits with such... firepower.
IF TOLLIN_MARTUMAL
Some of the merchants are having issues that seem to be holding them up. Ask around, maybe some of them could use your help.
Yes. It's not often you get this far down the High Road without something going terribly wrong. I just hope our luck holds up.
BK No, they were organized... and that wizard! Bandits don't usually carry that sort of power.

BJK 7/22/2015 -- only show this if we have not spoken about Martumal yet -- I linked a player response to handle default situation
I'm afraid there may be another casualty. I've accounted for everyone in the caravan except one: a driver named Martumal. I'm afraid the bandits took him back to their... hideout, or whatever.
I understand. Well, if you happen to see him....
That bastard! I should go over there and make him answer for what he's done!
BK He got what's coming to him.
BK I'd say that's about what he deserves. He got people killed out here!
BK Good. I never liked him anyway. I mean, good driver, but shifty. You know.
Oh, well. I talk tough, but I can't say attacking him will do my conscience any good. We'll figure this out when we get to Luskan.
BK By the gods, we've earned a little smooth road after today!
BK Do what you need to do. When you're ready, take the lead. We'll be right behind you.
The goblins had him and were torturing him.
BK This seemed like a really word node so I broke it in two.

Have you found Martumal? We're just about ready to go.
BK Adjusted Condition to fix bug https://jira.n-space.com:8101/browse/HOTU-10868 (If never mentioned Martumal, don't show this)
BK We need to get moving toward Luskan.
BK: added conditional here otherwise this dialog will continue to appear forever.
We haul merchants and goods between Neverwinter and Luskan once every couple of months... when the weather's good, and the way into Luskan isn't snowed over.
What sort of things are traded between Neverwinter and Luskan?

BK Not everyone can afford to ship by sea, and not everyone is carrying enough stock to make it worthwhile. And, well, to be honest, not everyone can afford to pay bribes at the docks to get their goods into town.
The overland route takes longer, and it's not the safest way to get there, but for some people, it's the only way.
BK: Coffee -> kaeth (according to WOTC style guide)

BK On this road, yes, from time to time. Bandits, goblins, the rare pack of hungry wolves. We never run into enough trouble to maintain a standing guard force, but it pays to hire in escorts on contract.

BK More often than not we can send the bandits away by giving in to their demands and sending them away with a full stomach and some small percentage of our goods. Goblins, on the other hand, aren't so reasonable.
Jaena said you were planning on killing her dog, Guen.

BK tweaked to account for the restructuring done.
I'm glad you brought that up. I need you to take that dog somewhere and kill it. Can't have it attacking the people who pay me.
BK You can try talking to Jessup if you want to.  I just want this whole situation to be behind us.
Neither do I.  But unless you can find something to contradict what Jessup told me I have to take care of my duties.  And my duty right now is to delegate these responsibilities to you.
Good, then go do your job.
BK Hoping this conditional is sufficient
BK this response only shows in initial conversation to give players a chance to go back and get important info
